unnormalised: ## Ditch the CDs, Embrace the Stream: Music's Gone Totally Digital, Yaar!
normalised: ## Ditch the C D s, Embrace the Stream: Music's Gone Totally Digital, Yaar!

unnormalised: Remember those days, folks? Scouring Chandni Chowk for the latest Bollywood film soundtrack on cassette? Or spending hours burning CDs after painstakingly downloading songs on dial-up? Those days are officially *kaput*, thanks to the rise of music streaming!
normalised: Remember those days, folks? Scouring Chandni Chowk for the latest Bollywood film soundtrack on cassette? Or spending hours burning C D s after painstakingly downloading songs on dial-up? Those days are officially *kaput*, thanks to the rise of music streaming!

unnormalised: Seriously, who needs physical copies anymore when you've got a whole world of music right at your fingertips? From A.R. Rahman's latest masterpiece to old Kishore Kumar classics, it's all there, just a click away.
normalised: Seriously, who needs physical copies anymore when you've got a whole world of music right at your fingertips? From A. R. Rahman's latest masterpiece to old Kishore Kumar classics, it's all there, just a click away.

unnormalised: I mean, think about it. You're stuck in Bangalore traffic, inching forward at 2 km per hour. What's going to keep you sane? A scratchy FM radio station with repetitive ads for hair oil? Nope! It's going to be your carefully curated Spotify playlist, blasting out everything from Carnatic fusion to the latest Punjabi pop sensation.

unnormalised: And it's not just about convenience, it's about discovery too. Streaming services have these amazing algorithms that suggest new artists and genres you might like. I recently discovered this amazing Rajasthani folk band through a recommendation engine, and now I’m obsessed!

unnormalised: The best part? Most of these services offer free tiers, supported by ads. Of course, if you want ad-free listening and the ability to download songs for offline playback (perfect for those long train journeys from Mumbai to Delhi!), you can opt for a premium subscription. It usually costs around Rs. 129 per month, which is less than the price of a single movie ticket at PVR!

unnormalised: Even prestigious institutions like IIT Delhi are embracing digital music. I heard they now have dedicated playlists for students to study to! Pretty cool, right?

unnormalised: So, if you’re still clinging to your old MP3 collection, it’s time to let go. Embrace the future of music. Download a streaming app, create a playlist, and get ready to groove! Trust me, your ears (and your patience) will thank you for it.
